corpus.description: Texts from Nuclear Threat Initiative website, created by Center for Non-Proliferation Studies
corpus.name: NTI

sentence.text: An individual can not enlarge his benefit by producing the good and charging others for using it , because of the free-rider problem .

Most importantly , since the rail links to Verdun had been severed by artillery fire , he enlarged the road for trucks between Bar-le-Duc and Verdun the ` Sacred Way " the only supply line to the front .
Coarse sand can not be used for this purpose , because it soon enlarges the hole through which it flows .
The navigator enlarged the image upon the three-dimensional screen .
If the space is very small and you want to enlarge it , put down all the possibilities .
At the front of the house the space cleared by the road and the river enlarged her perspective .
The Vietnamese government is now planning to enlarge the reserve .
Small cracks should be enlarged by chipping out more concrete to make a V-shaped channel .
The liver was enlarged by 2-3 cm .
This pattern library can be enlarged as the use of the program develops .
At junctions the tables were enlarged to cover the whole area of the intersection , permitting crossing by pedestrians and buggies without change of level .
If there is heavy rain , the spillways must be enlarged to allow the floodwater to escape before the dam bursts .
This process enlarged the intraskeletal pores and fractures and selectively removed crystals of dolomite to form intercrystalline pores .
The local school was established in 1824 , rebuilt in 1844 , added to in 1873 and enlarged in 1906 .
The cottage is essentially of the seventeenth century , but was restored in 1800 and greatly enlarged during the second half of the nineteenth century
